Review Text:
Very nice place. We love going to Wetherspoon whenever we are in the UK as the food and drinks are cheap and the portions are great for the price.
We ate there several times including for breakfast. Love that they offer many vegan options and that they have oat milk available for your coffee / tea.
This Wetherspoon was quite crowded because of rugby games but overall was great.

Dropped in on Halloween evening and full of fancy dressed people, music playing which was unusual for a spoons, but added to the atmosphere which was lively not like your normal spoons. Only had a drink, but our group enjoyed it in there. Great value drinks as ever but a lively atmosphere.

Manger said I can’t charge my Mobility Scooter whilst having a coffee and doing a bit of work, would have stayed for lunch only I will go somewhere that is more disabled friendly. Apart from this the staff are lovely and I do usually come a lot.
Went in here after the Bastille concert.  What a great atmosphere, staff were brilliant.  Loved the KISS fans that came in after their concert.
Decent spoons - Eggs benedict fail! Hard eggs...all 3 spoons we went to in Manchester could not do runny eggs!

Seven Stars couldn't get 0 stars. Bland food that makes a wet napkin have flavour. Staff that are rude and the side orders are managerial sass. Better atmosphere at a cemetery. A wet flannel has more personality than the manager

Had breakfast here several times and the quality of the food is very low. Over done toast, overcooked oily hash browns, under tomatoes and oily undercooked mushrooms and over cooked sausages. Also on last visit one of the two coffee machines needed a service was only dispensing coffee out of a single stream rather than two and the coffee was full of bubbles. Would not recommend breakfast here. Paramount cooks breakfast better.

Decent Wetherspoons in the City Centre although there are better. The venue is unique in how it's built but wasn't cleaned very well. Food was standard, service was good though. I might change my review if I visit again.
Nice vibe, DJ with a mini dance floor , enough to tables throughout the building and quick service for the size of venue , very happy with this spoons would recommend no doubt ! 5/5!

We had 10 people on our table to come in. All of us ordered on the app individually. It was very quiet Sunday lunch, not many people around. The food was terrible. Most of the food had obviously been cooked and just kept hot for hours waiting for someone to order it. My ‘mash potato’ was harder than a rock, and when asked for another the second was only marginally better but the bottom was still rock hard. The chilli sauce on most of my friends dishes were far too spicy even for the ones that liked spice, and when told about this there was no offer of replacement given by the staff, even though the 4 out of 10 that got the sauce said it was different to other spoons and it was definitely more spicy. 1 of the staff was very nice, the rest looked like they hated being there. Not good.

Decent atmosphere with cute little booths upstairs. it's a typical spoons with quick table service via their app. The food is decent enough - about what you'd expect of similar establishments.

Unfortunately they don't allow sportswear so make sure you wear appropriate clothes before heading here.
I have the chicken jalfrezi the Rice was tiny portion also cold and lumpy everything taste cheap and microwaved only think that was nice on the plate was the mango chutney and inside was cold
Gotta love this place. Proper food and drinks for fair prices.
A hidden spot near Arndale shopping center to wait for friends or kill time. Beers (pale ale) are lot cheaper than pubs around. starts from £2.x per pint Good spot !
Bit slow at bringing drinks to the table. But food was as fast as it is in other wetherspoons I've visited

Ordered food at the bar, order was incorrect, when I informed the member of staff she said 'That's what you ordered' 2 of the 3 meals were cold. Would not recommend dining there!!. Staff need to be trained on Customer Service.

Great place in the centre of Manchester and houses within the old printworks. Used to meet up with about 30 ex colleagues. We all enjoyed the atmosphere and would deffo go back again. Well worth a visit and the food is cheap, fast and tasty. Well done!
Went here just for a drink and it was very busy. 11:00 am. Very good service and the place is kept very clean. Good options of a meal with a drink. Free wifi.

Decent value for money.
Food was prepared quickly, warm, edible and had flavour (katsu curry).
People need to bear on mind that if you pay Peugeot prices, don't expect a Porsche.

I was at seven stars Wetherspoon  with my family the only time I get to see my family was spoilt by a manager speaking to someone calling them a liar then shouting at them as they were leaving this was in front of other customers!
We had food that was cold and bland ! I will never go to Wetherspoon seven stars again ! Disgusting behaviour from a manager
Simply one of the best people watching places in town.  Love it.   Good pint too

Great pub in the printworks. Good food choice of usual pub fare. Excellent choice of lagers, ales, wines and spirits. Seating is good. Disabled access is tight as is the entrance. Toilets are upstairs. Recommended.
Recommended Dishes: Burger and Fries, Fish and Chips, Chicken Tikka Masala

Review Text: Brilliant place, food was hot, service rapid and the lad serving me explained where coffee station and where to find sauce. Everwhere clean and tidy
Food and service was excellent as always. Played on the fruit machine which developed problems. Reported the problem to a manager who took my details. Still waiting for a resolution
Excellent table service with app. Great friendly atmosphere. Toilets upstairs but can accommodate disabled downstairs. Open till late at weekend.

Was hoping for a relaxing meal with Mrs C however what we received was anything but. Quality of food left a lot to be desired, I'm sure tripple cooked chips would command a premium elsewhere, dessert was poor and I have lost count of how many times I've heard the f word in the last half hour from several tables, dissappointing that the staff have not tried to calm things down a little. Poor food and disturbing atmosphere.
It's a spoons it does what it says on the tin...good food reasonably priced ans served with a smile...

Toilet attendant got weirdly angry that I wouldn’t give him any money for the massive task of handing me a piece of tissue paper. I think I’m capable of drying my hands on my own and don’t need to pay money for it. None of the toilets had paper in either

You can't beat Wetherspoons for value and service and this one was no different. We were served in quick time and the food was good. The place was very clean and the staff were friendly would deffo visit here again when I next venture to Manchester.
Recommended Dishes: Burger and Fries, Classic Burger and Chips, Burger, Golden Ale

Review Text: Gets busy, value for money drinks, our food wasn't great the burger was a bit like an old shoe without its laces.. would re-visit but wouldn't eat..

The staff are a bit lacking in customer service other than Joe who went out my way to help me with my order. I rarely leave reviews online but he was so helpful that I thought his service deserved a review. I’d give it seven stars if you will! Food was proper nice and I’d go back

Looked for a wetherspoons and this seemed to be in a nice quiet area.
Food up to the usual standard. Here for 5 days and will definitely pop in again before I leave the area.
Nice a busy as usual for a spoons. Food was lovely  quick service using the app.
Nice area of manchester and decent food, if you get your order. Been here 3 times and everytime I have not received my order and had to sit and watch my partner eat.
Great selection of drinks, enough space upstairs to sit down and overall very good service. Didn't eat so can't comment on food.

Cold food even though the place was empty and also told we didn't order tea even though we had the order on the phone to show them.  Shocking attitude from the manager who refused us the footage of us that he recorded.     ...   He seemed fixed on the missing tea when the complaint was about the freezing cold food. In fact the little pod of butter was warmer than my breakfast. Avoid.

A nice and affordable pub! Can’t go wrong with Wetherspoons. It was really rowdy when we were there, there was a group next to us who were being very loud and probably tipsy, so that marred our experience a little.
The food here is always decent and the drinks are very reasonably priced. I tried a pizza for the first time here and it was really good, I’ll definitely be getting it again soon.

Staff are friendly and helpful when you can see them but check backs would be a good idea. For the most part, the mixed grill was fine but we had burnt scampi and missing lamb from one mixed grill yet couldn't find anyone to bring this up with.
Another wetherspoons chalked of. Can't fault the prices as usual. Really good to see all these different wetherspoons. Knowing full well you're never be disappointed
Good environment!! Food was good and customer service still need a little bit of improvement.
Probably the best spoons I have ever been to .clean tidy.good staff.very helpfull. Would recommend to everyone.

Absolutely delighted with this Wetherspoons establishment. The very first one my husband and I have been to, where wvery mpty table was clean and inviting and we have been to a LOT of other Wetherspoons around the country.  The staff were friendly and  quick to clear the table after we ate.  We passed te time of day with  other customers and we could here ourselves speaking.  The toilets were clean and fresh too. TOP MARKS indeed
Cheap food but at a fair quality. There is a large selection of different types of food to chose between. The drinks menu is also quite large. It’s easy to order though their app.

Spent a few hours here on a Saturday afternoon. A very crowded and popular pup at all times and luckily we got a table as at 53, I need to sit these days!

We ordered through the app all the drinks and food and what surprised us is that the food came out before the drinks and they came fairly quickly as well.

The staff were great and very pleasant.

Tables clean, plenty of staff available if you need assistance of any kind and food/drink served quickly after ordering on the app.
Nice atmosphere as they had some music on too!
Prices are decent for a city centre pub too. Will definitely be visiting again soon 😁

Argyle on tour! Having arrived at Manchester after a 7hr journey by train I toured the city for an hour or so booked into my hotel and then went to have a beer and some food before busing out to Salford city to watch the Argyle,  And the Seven Stars was the perfect venue.  Two floors and a nice chilled late afternoon and a pint of Ruddles for £1.29!!!! Yes 1.29. Girls behind the bar were very pleasant and when I moved upstairs and eventually ordered curry and chips and another pint the guy behind the bar unselfishly went downstairs to pull the pint and bring it upstairs. And all for just over a tenner. Not the best garlic naan bread in the world and the rice was a bit sticky but nevertheless good value. It was busy. And after we had beaten City I came back and celebrated with another pint and some nuts.....what a wonderful world it is....football, beer.....and Wetherspoons.....what else is there!!!!
I went for something to eat before the pictures, the service was excellent had a nice meal and drink, would recommend.
It's a Wetherspoons..you know what to expect, if you are a red wine drinker then try the Coldwater Creek Ink Shiraz on draught..new to me,recommended by a friend and totally delicious
Great place for a beer & food. The chicken wings were brilliant
Recommended Dishes: Classic Burger and Chips, Fish and Chips, Chicken Tikka Masala

Review Text: Didn't have food but the Cider was lovely. Great prices and plenty of tables and chairs.

No Stella, Punk, Coors, San Miguel.  No breakfast menu and a reduced menu all in all a bad experience.......oh and one person serving at the bar on a Friday afternoon when the manager should know they're going to be busy!
Love this place food isn't the best but its weatherspoons so u get what u pay for lol
Usual great food and drink in a Spoons. Helpful staff 👍
Great place,foods lovely fab prices! Really nice atmosphere spent the afternoon in there and was very relaxed.will be going again in a weeks time x
Always a winner.  Great prices and quiet enough to have a good catch up.  This is the first place to start a good night off in City centre Manchester

First of all I might remind readers that I haven't had a drink in 7 years and yet i still enjoy a good night out.
This weekend are Disney themed stag party visited the Seven Stars In The Printworks Manchester City and was greeted by a fantastic staff happy to serve surprisingly high Spirits for the long night they were pulling surrounded by drunk people lol the door staff fantastic professional and had a great chat with them outside 'yes i was buzz lightyear''

Glasses were being collected constantly tables tidied even the manageress sorting out chairs at 1:30 in the morning still with a smile on her face while people were still moving them around a true passion for the job hats off to the team at the Seven Stars Manchester

We only when in for some toast, and a drink, my knock over his drink, i ask for a cloth to clean it up, the waitresses wouldn't let she cleaned it up  and even got him a refill, ready shows that the staff care, will go back for something to eat, as the staff made you feel welcome, would give staff 5+
Fabulous place to eat, food was good/hot/tasty. As usual Wetherspoons doesn't disappoint in their menu and prices.
Good place.. like all wetherspoons lacks atmosphere with no music.
Recommended Dishes: Steak and Frites, Great Pizza, Mixed Grill

Review Text: Food was good but not everything was available (pretty rare).

If you are looking for contemporary decor, fancy flaming cocktails and michelin star food this is not your place. But if you want a couple of pints or some pub grub on a budget this might be your destination. I had a meal and a decent pint for under £6. The food is not restaurant quality but it usually comes out quick and it hit the spot, also for the price you can't go wrong.

Went for a birthday meal, it was very busy and noisy. Moved upstairs so we could find a better table. Food was average, if you want a drink you can get one with the meal but have to pay a little extra. 😏 …

Customer service sadly lacking.

Staff chatting to one another instead of serving customers on two occasions.
Kept me waiting for over 5 mins before serving me even though there was nobody else waiting to be served.

Some staff members rude & unfriendly.

Wont be going into that place again .....spend my money elsewhere.

The large breakfast was the perfect balance of hot and cold food! The eggs bacon and beans were cold but the sausage and toast hot! Was the only customer in the building 😬  the free refill coffees from the machine was the best part …

Maybe a tad on the small side but actually a pretty nice scampi and chips. Had a leffe on tap. Busy on a Friday night but food came in 15 minutes.  Very mixed crowd and lively atmosphere. Sounds like a club night upstairs!
Didnt eat there  but served quickly...no atmosphere and not that clean but alright
Food was good, service was fast, would recommend using the witherspoon app.
Lovely fish n chips. Who doesn't like a Weatherspoons
Bang on, always enjoy Manchester, even though I'm from other side of pennines, seven stars adds to a good day out
Love this place and the food looked nice thanks
Ordered breakfast found hair on eggs food was cold appart from toast and bacon
Food was unedible service was disgusting when approached the manager was told I'm not changing or refunding your money stay away i
Good place to go for some food. Place gets abit loud due to the location
Popped in for a quick drink and bite to eat before our concert. Usual wetherspoons,  you know what you're getting.
It's a very good wetherspoons. Clean efficient and friendly
Went for a birthday celebration great choice of food and wine at reasonable prices

Pleasantly surprised on this visit managers special mixed grill £6-99 freshly cooked and actually hot! Keep it up 🍻 on a different note even though they're posting notices in the toilets for washing your hands... The tables are filthy and sticky... Just watched one customer ask the waiter to clean a visibly dirty table 🙄🤔 Get your act together Wetherspoons!
March 22... Wetherspoons always seem confused when you try to change peas, tomatoes and mushrooms on a mixed grill for some salad! Very little food being served, ordered a mixed grill (with salad) they salad was hotter than the chips!
Basic cooking, but even hot chips are a challenge to the "cooks" 🔥🍟

Was very clean and nice n quiet for a Spoons Pub!

Much nicer than the Moon on Deansgate where I usually go.

Will defo go again.
It's ok.... Hard to find something good about the place, at best it's good  for groups that don't want to spend a fortune. Staff a bit random serving at the bar, and it can get rowdy.

Nice early pint at the pub.
Quick and nice service

Unfortunately I have to write a review, I like whetherspoon for its amazing cheap prices and unlimited coffee, so this will not be my last time at whetherspoon. However, today we ordered through the app and our coffee came right away, the food took a lot longer… half an hour later asked if it was forgotten , then got a hostile attitude from the manager telling me I made a mistake with table numbers and they just couldn’t find me. Went to show the manager the confirmation with indeed the right table number but instead of an apology the manager doubled down on her passive aggressive behaviour, very sad to see such a wonderful place being managed this way towards its customers

Bar wench repeated my order for drinks and food back to me, but still managed to serve me the wrong drinks  and the wrong burger came out to me. Did not have time to get a replacement due to going to an event and when explained to server the response was 'oh ok' and a retreat before I could say anything else.

Based on previous reviews this appears to be 'the norm' for this venue... I didn't thing the default wetherspoons service could actually be worse as a standard... But apparently The Seven Stars has a definite "Hold My Beer" mentality to proving it could be worse and doing their best to do so.
Able to get a seat and move around which is all that can be asked in a busy venue such as this. Food was lovely and service was good, toilets were clean and no issues.
Not the finest wetherspoon but decent enough. Food and drink served quickly. Quality pretty good. Server could have smiled a bit more. Tables felt a little close together but still an enjoyable meal.
Can't beat spoons cheap food beer and spirits generally a good atmosphere located at the top of the printworks good for meeting up and pre cinema beers
Another typical Spoons pub. Busy with locals. Free wifi. decent tap beer choice.  I didn't eat here, I just had a half pint of craft beer
Clean, tidy very friendly staff and yummy cocktails
Food was lovely and delivered super quick. Staff were friendly
Great pub good service. Readable prices
Liked it cheap and busy but served quickly

Been in here numerous times, but the menu has recently changed and not for the better.
I’ve had better burger and chips at a roadside greasy spoon.
Luckily the beer made up for it.
I think we will give it a miss next time I’m out in Manchester.

very unpleasant experience here. Would swerve this bar as THEY WILL remove your drink from the table if you go to the toilet or outside for a brief moment. The manager had zero interest understanding that, worst weatherspoons in the country.

Spoons conveniently located in Printworks. Busy on a Saturday night, although we were able to find a free table upstairs.

Ordered at upstairs bar, as there was no queue, although it still took a few minutes to be served. Would come back again when it's quieter mid-week.

I thought this was quite an impressive venue. There are 2 floors, quite a nice friendly atmosphere although it was only 3pm when I came here. As with any wetherspoons the food and drinks menu is extensive and good value. Service was friendly and there was a lot different seating.

Like most Weatherspoons
Very pleasant atmosphere.

Nice pub with a good atmosphere but the barman was horrific - rude to the point of being aggressive. Oh dear... tables packed so tight you can't breathe. Great start to a day out . Get a big plate of beer soaker

Great music a multitude of ages and a great atmosphere, good prices for location. Packed but good rotation of patrons so not a long wait for a table. Plenty of space and dance floor at night time
It's a weatherspoons in the city, same as every weatherspoons in every city. Can get very busy
Took my son for food after The Vue in the Printworks. I'd go back again.
Tuna & cheese Panni was shocking and late arriving to the table..
A Very Busy Wetherspoons pub. Always clean. Friendly staff. Food served quickly and always served with quality. Some amazing value on their beer 🍺 too 👍 …
Quick pint after the tennis. Really quick service

The seven stars is quieter than your usual pub but not because of a lack of clientele but more so to do with the general ambience of the place. What I love about the seven stars is the top notch service. They're menu is diverse as well and the pricing for the drinks and food are decent and fair. If your looking for an affordable and welcoming pun, I would recommend the seven stars at Printworks.
Super fast service and the food was hotter than usual for a 'spoons.
Well priced good food and beer, nice area and a comfortable ambiance.

It's a great pub, but because of location on a Friday/Saturday night you'll be hard pressed to find a table or seat. If your heart is set on drinking here you need to grab a table early. Unlike most spoons I think this one does play music later on in the evening.
One of the better spoons in the town centre.  This and moon are probably the best ad the food is constant. And of course cheap drinks
Nice place, chill atmosphere decent food and staff are friendly.
We had a breakfast it was cold won't be going back
Too many staff can't pull a pint the way like it. They just keep pulling till the glass is full. Then it goes flat too quickly. I am not saying this is all staff, but it needs sorting.
Nice clean pub all usual wetherspoons  facilities

Drinks and food arrived promptly, but food tasted very bland. The halloumi burger was served as a few halloumi fries on a piece of bread. The ladies toilets were amongst a large amount of tables. Not sanitary at all! Up your game spoons
Ok ish pub   great for the city centre 👍

Love the coffee plus as many refills as you want
Good food, great company.  My first real meal since arriving in the UK, comes highly recommended by Jeff.

The food was ok, however the halloumi burger was just halloumi fries in a bun would not recommend and the halloumi was cold. And the female toilets were through lots of tables where people were eat, i doubt that is enjoyable for the customers.

Great beer

Pleasant bar staff, good prompt service.

Refused entry by cocky brain dead security for literally no reason.

I enjoyed this pub so much

Usually love this place, but salad had rotten leaves( ok, it happens. Occasionally) However when asked if everything was OK and we showed the salad, the response was, "OK, I'll let them know". Never heard back.

A nice brightly lit pub/ diner family place .Set on the corner and  opposite the Vue cinema at The Printworks Manchester. Very busy, with two levels of seating areas I  found it had a friendly,  atmosphere, fast attentive service and the cocktail pictures were good xx

It's a relatively good spoons this is, lots of seating over two floor, nice staff and classic spoons quality food. Is a bit pricier than ones out of the city center which is a bit annoying. Cheap and ok  only went in to meet up with friends

Nice staff, plenty of seating and everywhere clean makes it a good example in the chain. The location is great too in a prime spot for a night out. The prices are a little more than other pubs in the chain but it still offered fantastic value for money and being open late into the night means it’s an idea spot to head. I’ll certainly be returning!
Does what it says on the tin, decent spoons with reasonably priced drinks and a good selection of real ales. Food was your typical spoons offering and it hit the spot for a tenner and a pint.
Poached egg was cold. I usually don't mind breakfast at Wetherspoons but this was awful. Coffee was awful too. Tasted like tar. Giving 2 stars purely for the lovely friendly staff.
Awful place, probably one of worst spoons ever been in.
Good, like all werthspoons not athan staff behind the bar

My daughter and I visited Manchester and decided on here for lunch. It was pretty busy yet we found a table that just needed clearing. Then a member of staff told me they were full, and when i pointed out said table she was very rude n continued to yell at me they were full. We promptly left...
Very packed today with lots of male groups as its getting near Xmas,but surprised to see a trial beer by lord's brewery at 99 pence and drinkable, 😋👍 …
Excellent called in for breakfast and was not disappointed very tasty and plentiful

Good open space weatherspoons.

During my visit unfortunately they run out of almost all food on the menu which was slightly disappointing however I found that the service was fast when ordering through the app.

What you will find as in most places in Central Manchester the prices are inflated compared to other weatherspoons . -specifically the once in more rural areas will have much lower prices. Overall it was a plesant experience and it is highly likely that I'll be visiting again.

Decent enough spoons. Fairly quick service for such a busy location
Cheap n cheerful... Went to the crown and anchor on shambles and the same drink ((Carling) was £5, just £2.85 in spoons.. a no brainer.

Nice place but it was so busy and tables were hard to get but the staff managed to find me one thanks to them 👍 and the service was excellent and very good …

I generally liked it in here. Friendly service, was sat at an ideal table for just myself and the drinks were top notch. The food I ordered was good, except for the garlic bread. That was more like rosemary or something similar and not garlic. Slightly annoying. Would go again but would not recommend ordering their garlic bread!

Had a good night in this pub, its a weatherspoons so similar to other wetherspoons although later on they had a DJ and music and it got very lively. Would definitely go back.
There was one bartender who was rather rude banging our jugs ordered down on the table and walking off before we could ask for glasses.
Must of been having a bad day, not good for custom tho!

Bog standard Spoon if you ask me. Friendly staff, cheapish drinks and okay food. We did get seated at an uncleaned table and it took staff 15 minutes to come over to clean it off but thats what you can expect on a busy friday evening.

Would come here again if I get the chance

Hopeless. Waited nearly an hour for food to find out they'd not made it.

Nice place to have a good drink and some fast food. Good atmosphere and service. Good prices.

We orders 3 traditional breakfasts.
When we ordered they were ran out of sausages. So when we ordered we wanted 2 breakfasts normal and one without tomato and no beans and swapped for other items. The woman reading the order said it correctly.
We got out cutlery before the meal and when the waiter came she dropped it on the table as she walked past and the cutlery was crusty and disgusting.
However, when the order came, all there meals had no tomato and no beans and swapped for other items. We sent 2 back and we had to actually ask for them back with their added tomato and beans. Argyle on tour! Having arrived at Manchester after a 7hr journey by train I toured the city for an hour or so booked into my hotel and then went to have a beer and some food before busing out to Salford city to watch the Argyle,  And the Seven Stars was the perfect venue.  Two floors and a nice chilled late afternoon and a pint of Ruddles for £1.29!!!! Yes 1.29. Girls behind the bar were very pleasant and when I moved upstairs and eventually ordered curry and chips and another pint the guy behind the bar unselfishly went downstairs to pull the pint and bring it upstairs. And all for just over a tenner. Not the best garlic naan bread in the world and the rice was a bit sticky but nevertheless good value. It was busy. And after we had beaten City I came back and celebrated with another pint and some nuts.....what a wonderful world it is....football, beer.....and Wetherspoons.....what else is there!!!!

If you are looking for contemporary decor, fancy flaming cocktails and michelin star food this is not your place. But if you want a couple of pints or some pub grub on a budget this might be your destination. I had a meal and a decent pint for under £6. The food is not restaurant quality but it usually comes out quick and it hit the spot, also for the price you can't go wrong.
